content.detailedDescription: I and two other whitnesses were scanning the sky and watching for fireworks and as we were doing so, i saw a group of what looked like 3 flares that just shot up. they were coming up over the distant tree line that was about three miles away. they were well above the tree line, then a group of them appeared, a sort of very bright red orange lights, about twenty or twenty-five of them. they were moving southwest. lasted about five to ten minutes, before appearing to disappear within the clouds or just fade out.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Massive fleet in southeastern sky

content.detailedDescription: N in the beggining than movved to 45 degree angle evenualy spaced apart. tha moved into horizontal poisition and the spaced horizontal l shape than despurts into random pattern of separt sightings in all directions still three objects with orange lights, apparantly watching the fireworks, we were in boats and mutiple people witnessed sightings and have caught video on cell phones
content.summary: Orange lights hubbering over lake mattoon watching the fireworks in verticale formatio

content.detailedDescription: Whatever this thing was it was amazing.  i was on my back deck facing the nw sky it came out of nowhere, it moved from west to east and backed up slowly, this object seemed  slowly came back toward the east (of course i live near lake erie only 60 miles) it seem to huvver over the lake and slowly rose into the sky.. the bright orange light went out and it reappeared  bout 1 minute later only lower to the ground and it proceeded to go se of me.  it was not a jet cuz 2 minutes later the air force jets were flying over!!! i freaked out and tried to take pics on my phone they never came thru.
content.summary: Afireball that moved side toside and rose into the sky

content.detailedDescription: At about 11.30 pm on sat, july 3rd 2011.My 16 year old son and i was sitting on our front steps facing south west looking at the fireworks display about a half mile away at the long island, ny. ducks baseball stadium, at about 5 minutes after the show the smoke began clearing. i saw 2 white lights appearing at a (4)magnitude, they were about a hand fist appart of each other and then began glowing brighter and not moving, i told my 16 year old son that was sitting next to me to look up and see the 2 lighted objects glowing brighter and it stayed at it's brightest at about a (-1) mag.And twinkling for about a minute and then slowly fading away into noting for about 10 seconds, the time of the 2 white lights appearing in the sky and then fading away lasted for about 3 minutes.My son and i discussed the sitting and agreed that it was not two stars, because there were other stars visible in that area.It appeared together, and then disappeared together into noting without moving left or right, nor up or  down.I have seen other strange lighted objects moving along the sky before, but this was assuring of my first close up ufo, being amazed at this siteing i forgot to take a picture with my cellphone, but i will be ready in the future.I hope that someone else saw something in my area and contact mufon to confirm this siteing.
content.summary: 2 star like objects appeared over the south western horizon above a fireworks show at the little ducks baseball stadium

content.detailedDescription: Last night (7/3/11) between 10:00 and 10:30pm, while watching fireworks from one of our hill top pastures, four of us (3 adults, 1 child) saw three separate red glowing objects move across the night sky.  the first one appeared to be heading steadily in our direction, to the right and above where we were parked.  thinking it was a wayward firework we kept watching and waiting for it to explode ��� it didn���t.  the light was moving in a straight-ish line, going faster than a low flying plane, but didn���t seem to be making any noise that we could hear between the explosions of fireworks going off in a many mile radius around us.  eventually my daughter got out of the truck and walked further out into the field to get a better, quieter view.  while it was a fairly dark, clear country night we couldn���t make out anything but the spherical-looking light itself.  my husband and i kept watching the fireworks with our grandson, occasionally checking back on the bright red glow.  my daughter remained out in the darkness, yelling across the large open field periodically to draw our attention back to the object.  she kept on eye on it for minutes as it continued behind us, where she said it seemed to be moving southward - then suddenly she could no longer see it, but she didn���t know if the light went out or maybe the object's position changed so the light was no longer visible.  within a few minutes of losing sight of the first one another red glow appeared from beyond the tree line and seemed to follow a similar trajectory as the first.  after disappearing from view we saw a third one.  about fifteen minutes later we left.  there were no others that we noticed, and the whole strange sighting happened over maybe 10 or 15 minutes.   we speculated on whether it might be some kind of firework or connected to a nearby government contractor that has been involved in work on military stealth aircraft.
content.summary: 3 sightings of red spherical lights moving slowly across night sky near ny/pa state line

content.detailedDescription: In downtown howell for farmers market. standing on county courthouse grounds, partly cloudy day with cotton ball clouds at about 5-8000 ft. high stratus clouds most likely around 20,000 ft. at 11:55am (i checked cell phone for time after i realized what i saw) i looked up checking clouds out and saw white disc traveling in circles. i first thought that seagull was extremely fast and high, then i noticed that it was disc, and it went behind stratus "mares tails" and then back into blue sky at least three times, then flew away or i lost it. total time of sighting was 12-20 seconds.  looked for another 10 mins but did not find it. reminded me of you-tube video of "mothership" from london, but higher. thought all night whether i should make report, but i did see what i report. it was not bird, i saw birds and they were noticeably lower and darker, this almost "glowed" white.
content.summary: White circle very high se sky above clouds moving in circles, behind clouds

content.detailedDescription: While waiting for fireworks to begin to celebrate canada day celebrations, i was recording with my digital still camera the location of the expected fireworks, when my children noticed 3 floating spheres approx 50 feet ?? in the sky to the right of us. they were floating silently and slowly. they were lit with an orange glow, so that i could not actually see the objects, just the light. i looked closely at them to discern if they were balloons etc, but they did not look like anything i have ever seen. i filmed the second set of 3 objects. i did not film the first set as i was trying to figure out what they were, and i was trying to conserve my sd card memory space for the fireworks. when i noticed the 2nd set, i filmed it, as they were quite unusual. both sets of objects were "floating" to the right and behind us. both sets were in the same configuration, and maintained the configuration throughout the sighting. balloons would not float together, especially 2 sets. i stopped filming due to the fact that the fireworks were beginning, and the objects floated away. i'm not sure what these were, but they were unlike anything i have seen. near the end of the video, the black vertical line is a wooden telephone post. i have included the video for your evaluation. please let me know via email what you think of this. best regards
content.summary: 2 sets of 3 floating spheres

content.detailedDescription: We were waiting for fireworks to start. there were probably 2000 or so people there. we were looking southwest. my three friends who were with me and i saw a reddish orange sphere appear to the south. if i had to guess, i would say it was 10, 15 thousand ft high, probably 35 degrees off the horizon. it slowly moved toward us, maybe a few miles in 5 seconds. it stopped, grew brighter, more intense. it was about 5 or 6 times larger than a star. it stayed stationary for 20 or thirty seconds, varying in intensity. it then drifted away slowly, the direction it came from, about the same distance, then darted east. it moved 3 or 4 miles in less than a second, then seemed to fade away.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Reddish orange light appears, maneuvers, disappears

content.detailedDescription: My son-in-law went outside for a cigarette, he called inside for me to come outside quick.  he pointed to this disc which was about 90 degrees above us but a little to the south.  the bottom was sparkling in very bright lights that are hard to describe.  they were orange and yellow and were changing.  my first thought was something was on fire.  the size was like a fruit jar lid held at arms length.  it was moving fast from east to west.  as it moved away you could see the shape which reminded me of a circular parachute like they used in wwii.  it was black in color.  it took about 15 seconds to move from above us to behind the trees across the street.  it is hard to judge the size but it seemed large we had no idea as to how high it was in the sky.  the sac airbase would be less than 50 miles from the sighting and i thought it odd that they didn't check this out.  we both had cameras, but were so dumbfounded neither thought of filming this.  it's the weirdest thing i've ever seen.
content.summary: Black, disc with a dome, entire bottom sparkled with yellow and orange light

content.detailedDescription: My husband, 2 children and i were walking home from getting ice cream on july 3,2011.There were fireworks going off around us so as we walked we observed them. we turned onto 84th avenue and walked about a block up the street. my daughter then said to us, "look at the 3 airplanes." we looked to the west and saw just below cloud level, 3 illuminated red objects in a triangular pattern. (1 above,2 below) they were stationary and they seemed to be equidistant from each other. my family froze and watched in amazement trying to figure out what it was. i threw my water bottle to my husband and quickly took out my iphone to take a picture. i took a picture. the objects were too far away for the picture to be visible. after about 2 minutes, the top illuminated light appeared to be moving to the left of the other 2 and disappeared from sight--possibly into the cloud cover. the remaining 2 stayed illuminated for about another minute then slowly dimmed and faded out at the same exact time. we waited a moment to see if they would return. as we continued walking home, we kept our eye on the sky and saw nothing more. when we got home, my husband and i both went online to see if anyting had been reported. neither one of us knew the other was looking up this information. what we saw clearly "freaked" us out!
content.summary: To our west we saw 3 glowing red objects forming a triangular shape in the sky below the clouds

content.detailedDescription: We live in a suburban area. i went outside just before 11:00pm sunday night. it was a calm, clear night. i locked my shed, went and turned on the garden hose so i could water the tomato plants, when i saw an orange red bright light moving slowly above the tree line. because it was july 3rd and people were lighting fireworks, i thought maybe it was some kind of lantern or something. then i saw another one following behind it. i watched them move slowly across the sky when 3 more appeared single file moving on the same route. the first 2 turned, single file, and started moving up & away from my vantage point. i ran inside and got my wife to come out to see them. see made it out in time to watch the first 2 slowly disappear from sight and the next 3 make the same turn and start to go up and away from us. she said "are they planes or helicopters"? i said "they have no flashing lights & no sound ". all this time i was trying to get my cel phone's camera/video to work but i couldnt see anything in the viewer(stupid phone!) i then called my daughter in iowa to tell her what we saw. i let her talk to her mother so she would't think her old man had flipped out. as my wife was telling her what we saw, 2 more appeared, traveling the same route. the last of the 7 was larger & brighter the the preceding 6. i ran into the house and got my hunting rifle with a 9x scope to look at the last 2 ufo's and all i could see were larger brighter orange red lights. my wife proceded to described the sighting to my daughter until the last 2 disappeared. i would estimate this sighting took a good 12-15 minutes in duration. i know with all the people out lighting fireworks, other people had to see these and hopefully they know how to operate there cell camera/video! i looked at my phone & the call to my daughter lists 11:01 pm and it lasted 8m 43sec. then i remembered i had turned on the garden hose & proceded to water the plants & freak-out!
content.summary: 7 ufo's moving single file july 3, 2011 11:00pm in rochester hills michigan

content.detailedDescription:
We were at algonac and it rained really hard, then stopped we took cover ina beer tent. then the sky turned almost completely black, the rain came down so hard everyone in tent escaped into the building attached. there was hail on ground. there are thousands still without power. when we started walking to our car is when we saw it. i think mother in law says it was red on top and had orange underneath it. i was in awe and joking that it was a ufo. my husband said it was triangle shaped. i thought more round or maybe a teardrop. not sure. i have never seen anything like this before. there are others that saw same thing.  i did a search and found two videos on youtube from same date. . one from windsor canada, where a few other people posted that they saw the same thing, from detroit. they saw 2 dozen of these orange red objects.Here is the link [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg] .. then there is a video from shelby michigan, same date. [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]
 
there was something different same date seen in warren, mi. and then  a reply to the  post  from a man in rochester, mi. same date saw same thing as we did. [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg] i am trying to connect everyone that saw the same thing, others are saying it was chinese lanterns but these were no chinese lanterns. this thing was flying. with that rain a bonfire couldnt have stayed lit, it came down with such force, like ive never seen before in my life. my husband first noticed it and told us. i thought it was a ufo, but just joking. it was directly above us. my husband is more detail oriented than i am, if you need to speak to him,im sure he would
content.summary: Red orange object hovered around us then took off to the north from algonac, mi. maybe hour after torrential downpour.

content.detailedDescription: at a friends house in oregon city, oregon. sitting around a fire talking. i spotted the big dipper and while helping one of my friends locate it ...I saw these two very bright starlike lights ...Sorta looking like one was in front of the other moving very slowly. my friend, who had had trouble locating the dipper then said 'yeah they are moving' . we, the five of us, watched as the lights sort of spiraled upward into the sky and dimmed as they appeared to go up.They seemed at one point to have a dull light connection between them. they continued to slowly rise and spiral and then dimmed to the point where we could no longer see them. the whole event was approximately 3 to 5 min. in duration. i attempted to video it on my cell phone camera but, it didnt show up.
content.summary: Looked like two large bright stars  *          *    one in front of the other moving slowly getting brighter ..Then sort of spiraling upward and dimming with dull connection between then dimming to disappearing.

content.detailedDescription:
I had just gotten home and was taking stuff inside making trips, when i was drawn to a bright unblinking star somewhat north if me in the sky, heading east, probably in the skies over northern palm beach or orlando.  it had a white color light and was moving at the speed of an aircraft...However, aircraft all have blinking lights on the wings, fuselage etc.  i used to be in the airline industry so i know this.

the thing that made this highly, highly unusual was while i was watching, the light turned dim as if it was turned down,  for around three seconds...Then it completely extinguished.

i never panicked nor nothing, i just watched, wondering what it was.  my camera really does not do very well in night time sky shots so i never bothered to get it.  

aircraft do not do behave like that. satellites do not do this because the lights reflected from them would be basically constant especially since it is heading east.  it would have picked up the sun's reflection that high up and remain lit. 

i think i always knew that i might see a strange sky object/occurrence in my lifetime, i just thought it might have been more dramatic than this, nevertheless, this was unusual.
content.summary: Bright unblinking star heading east then extinguished

content.detailedDescription:
I saw it coming from the west, heading northeast. it was way out, but i thought i kept seeing one light, then two. i even closed one eye to make sure my eyes were not playing tricks on me. i still couldn't tell ya if it was one light or two. i see jets and planes pass every night as i watch the stars before bed, but this one caught my eye. i have never reported anything. ever.

i was smoking a cigarette as that is my usual routine before bed. i usually smoke about 3. i live near of bethel road and interstate 20. it's plenty dark out here at night. every few months i get to see a satellite when the conditions are right.

i thought this was a satellite at first, then noticed it was not taking an orbit course. so i kept watching. it started a direct eastward path. it must have passed me at about 5 to 10k feet up, and 3-5 miles to the north. totally silent. i can hear cars on the road for miles out here for miles, no exaggeration. it was moving at roughly 100-150 mph. i am judging this by the speeds i see cessnas go by. it was way too fast for a balloon, and too silent for a plane or jet. i kept watching in awe, but it just kept going, silently. i looked down at my cigarette and it was about a puff away from being out. that is how i judged the time.

it passed the house a few miles to the north and i kept trying to get a focus on it with one eye. it passed on silently head almost due east with a slight northward aim. no strobes, no noise. could it be carswell jrb with something interesting. unsure, but i can tell you the fourth of july would be no time to be playing with something like that. everyone is looking up and out and about.
content.summary: 1-2 lights, orange/white, no strobes, totally silent, too fast for a balloon!

content.detailedDescription: I was in lumberton,texas listening to a friend of mine's new band. i decided to go outside and have a smoke. another friend followed me outside also. we were talking about the band and other bs when she ask me which way was north. so i decided to show her the north star. after showing her the star i looked toward the west horizon and was looking up up at about a 60 degree angle. this is when a bright light suddenly appeared out of nowhere. it was about 25 percent larger than most the stars in the sky. it was really quite bright, almost like a full moon but brighter. it stayed in one spot for a fraction of a second then moved to the right. it moved in a northeastern direction, at a speed i have never experience. it suddenly stopped and just hovered for a second, then its light went out. when it moved it left a trail of light as wide as the object also. i searched for it for about another half hour but never say it again. the reason i mentioned the speed was because i worked with f14 tomcats and other fighter jets when i was in the navy. i have never seen something with this kind of speed. it was like something out of star trek. it happened so fast i wasn't able to get any pictures. it still boogles my mind about this experience, i was always a little skeptical about these things but not anymore.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: I saw a light move at a extreme speed and stop suddenly

content.detailedDescription: We were waiting to watch the fireworks and noticed this bright orange light moving through the sky, to the east of me, moving from south to north.  it was brighter than an airplane (and lower in the sky than one) and definitely not a firework.  no noise to indicate it was a helicopter.  so i am not sure what to think!  it is an unidentified flying object!  if anyone knows what it is/was, let me know.  thanks.
content.summary: Orange light slowly moving through sky

content.detailedDescription: Just before a july 3rd fireworks display in barrington il there were 8 triangular shaped bright orange lights up in the sky. they moved slowly across the sky and lasted about 8-10 minutes until they started to fade away. it was an unbelievable sight! at first we all throught they were airplanes in the distance flying together to see fireworks but as they grew closer we realized that they were just bright orange lights. it was kind of creepy.. looked as if they were a scene out of "independece day" as if they were getting ready to come say hi from outerspace!!! it was awesome!!! upon our arrival home from the fireworks (approx 10:40pm)and the complete opposite direction where we first saw the 8 lights.. we saw 2 additional orange lights that where right behind one another and faded out together. it was quite the sight!!!! i did  happen to get a picture but i have an old iphone and the pic is a little blurry but at least we have one!!!
content.summary: Eight triangular bright orange lights over barrington, il

content.detailedDescription: On our deck observing the sky from dusk to darkness. noticed an object traveling south to north shaped like a dumbbell, as wide as a commercial airliner  but not as long, dull amber/gold colored, with no outstanding features.  what we noticed is that the object was void of faa lighting, nothing flashing.  even though the object was in a typical area that planes routinely took to portland international airport from the south, the description was not the usual blinking red and white customarily seen and identified as common commercial aircraft. at first, i took exception to the sighting not thinking it was anything out of the ordinary, but it became apparent to me after witnessing that the object was not in accordance with faa regs. i know that to be without exception that it was either a legitimately marked aircraft or not, the latter being the case. it maintained a steady course toward the north as any aircraft would under normal conditions and faded into the city lights 20 deg. above the horizon. very perplexing.
content.summary: Shaped like a dumbell.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing on my deck around 10:30 pm looking at some fireworks to the east and saw what at first i thought was some kind of flare. it appeared just over the trees to the east of my house and looked to be climbing slowly. it started on a shallower trajectory before i lost it behind the trees to the south east. it was round with a reddish orange glow and moved about 30 degrees horizontally in a minute. too slow to be a bottle rocket and went too far to be a flare. no lights showing it to be a plane. i would have been looking at it from it's right side where there should have been a green light on a wingtip. there were no anti-collision lights either. the weather report from the local airport in south bend was showing broken clouds above 12,000ft and visibility over 10 miles. whatever it was was below that.
content.summary: Round, red/orange glow, slow moving

content.detailedDescription:
I was out in my front yard at about 10 p.M. this evening watching the neighborhood fireworks going off.  as i turned to go back in the house, i spotted a bright orange light moving slowly across the sky coming from the northwest.  at first i thought it might be an airplane, but the light was too big, and the object was moving much too slowly to be a plane, and there was no sound.  it came to a dead stop, and i must admit, chills ran all through me, i couldn't believe what i was seeing.  it hovered for a few minutes, then it moved off to the east and went behind some clouds.  as it hovered i noticed that on each side of the orange light there was dimly lit rectangular windows. i did not have my camera with me, so i did not get any pictures.

did anyone else see this object around 10 p.M. on july 3, 2011 over the kansas city area?  i can't believe i am the only one who saw it, since there were so many fireworks going off and people would be looking upwards in the sky. 

the object would have passed over i-70 and noland road and would have been plainly visable from the ball park (although i don't think there was a game tonight)
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright orange light

content.detailedDescription: It was about 10 after 10 pm this evening, july 3, 2011 when i stepped outside to look at the sky.  it was a beautiful, clear sky filled with stars.  a few seconds after looking up i saw a very bright object moving from north to south.  it was moving steady and as it passed overhead, it appeared to have a triangular shape.  there appeared to be two, bright lights shining side by side and there were no other lights.  lights were steady with no blinking.   there was no sound whatsoever.   the object moved at a steady clip but there was no way to know how high it was.  at arms length it appeared to be about 1/2 the size of my little fingernail.  the entire sighting lasted maybe 15 to 20 seconds.  as it reached about 40 degs. above the southern horizon the lights went out. it was as though a switch was turned off. i could still see a faint object of the same size but it quickly moved off and disappeared.  i found out when i came in that my wife, who was in the backyard walking the dog, saw it also but thought it was a plane.  i was in the air force for 4 years and i've seen many things in the sky over the past 70 yrs including a broken up satellite re-interring the atmosphere overhead in hawaii, but i've never seen anything like this. from now on when i go out, i'll take the camera.
content.summary: Very bright triangular object on which lights turned off but still seen before fading out.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting outside with my dad tonight (july 3, 2011) on our front step around 10:30 pm in philadelphia enjoying the 4th of july weekend when i noticed an orange ball floating in the sky.

having just watched a fireworks display at the park behind my house that had ended 15 minutes earlier, i initially thought it was a stray spark floating in the wind and brushed it off. i had pointed it out to my dad and he agreed that it was just that.

however, the spark did not fizzle out like we've seen happen with other fireworks - and we began to realize that it was moving at a slow, steady speed in the direction of my house. then, it curved and headed north. it started out as a tiny ball, but as it moved we watched it shrink down into a pin point and vanish somewhere over northeast philadelphia.
content.summary: Orange glow ball over philadelphia

content.detailedDescription: There was four of us out by the firepit in the back yard watching for satelites when out of the west came this orange ball of light.  this object was brighter than the iss and moving a little quicker across the sky than the iss.  there were no flashing lights, just a steady bright orange glow and no sound.  the object kept a steady pace across the sky directly over head from west to east at 11:52 pm. sunday 07/03/11... three of the four of us who witness this event, are pilots.  we know it wasn't a plane. the object moved to quick and was to bright for a satelite.  we pretty much guessed it might be a metor skimming across the atmosphere. it's not like anything we have ever witness before.  we watched the object fly beyond the tree line where we lost sight of it.  truly amazing to see.
content.summary: Orange ball moving across the sky from west to east

content.detailedDescription: I was in my front yard and observed a bright orange red  pulsating light low on the horizon, but stationary. many planes pass above my house on their way to milwaukee. their bright white lights with red or green wing tip lights are easy to identify. this was not. i was looking in a south easterly direction when viewing the light. i went inside and continued to observe it as it seemed to ascend higher in the sky until lost in the clouds.
content.summary: Orange/red pulsating light

content.detailedDescription:
I was filming a high altitude jet with my casio exf1 pro high speed camera at about 12x optical zoom and infinite focus and 600 frames per second.   upon reviewing the footage i saw a cigar shaped object streak across the frame.   i can't explain what it is but it was very fast.  a bug close to the lens using that amount of zoom and infinite focus would not have appeared like this and a bug far enough to be in focus would not have had that type of speed.  i still do not have any explanation for what i saw in my hs camera footage,  and that bothers me.

here is the video footage:

[link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]
content.summary: Ufo filmed with high speed camera  at 600 fps

content.detailedDescription: July 3rd, fireworks going off in the neighborhood, had steaks on the grill and went out to pull them off, i looked northeast low on the horizon and could not believe what i saw, i opened the sliding glass door and called for my wife, we both stood on the deck and witnessed i say 12 she says 8 glowing objects way off in the distance, i mentioned to her that they were all way too close together to ever be man flown aircraft, we sat watching them slightly move about, sometimes their light would completely turn off, othertimes it would cycle thru red, white, blue and green. after about 2 minutes all of them were gone. these in no way could have been aircraft or fireworks, a firework at somepoint would have to give in to gravity and descend, these continued to rise out of view, slowly but steady. much to my surprise one appeared to be right over my neighbors roofline, i grabed the video camera for this one! it traveled northwest over the house, another neighbor who was shooting roman candles into the nightsky appeared to "want" to hit the object, his aim seemed pretty good but never reached it's height. i don't know if he was 4 or 5 houses down from me, tomorrow i'm gonna knock on some doors untill i find who it was and interview him of what he saw and thought.
content.summary: 8 to 12 glowing lights lined up in sky

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were driving on highway 44 west near the pacific exit.  he noticed a string of lights that we first thought were airplanes.  we pulled over and watched this string of lights traveling across the sky, a few would bunch up then go back in the line formation.  

my husband described them as a string of lights, maybe 20 lights, evenly spaced and the center had a vertical triangle of three lights; the string of lights was approx. 1000 feet long.

we pulled over and watched them for a few minutes, then traveled on to the washington exit where we turned onto highway 100.  just prior to getting off the highway, we saw a helicopter turning from the exit at 44 and 100 back toward where we saw the lights.  

we hazard to guess that someone was sending up lighted baloons, but they were so high, and bright!  there were fireworks going off up and down the highway, but this was pretty crazy looking and we have never seen fireworks like that!

we tried to take a picture, but it was too far away.
content.summary: String of lights in sky

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were walking our dogs,when we noticed this low flying object,round star like.It went from nw to se and it made no noise. we watched it until it just faded out. we know it was some type of unusual object.We both felt a little shocked and my dog would not move for a minute or two,she refused to move.
content.summary: Low flying round light

content.detailedDescription: I was outside smoking a ciggatte like always. i always look at the sky when i saw this star moving i was freaking out i couldnt belive it then it meade a quick shrap turn like an l then it started to fade away as it was fading away it turned orange getting smaller an an smaller till it was gone i tried to take a picture but it happend so fast.
content.summary: It look just like a star then it faded away
